original_title: Phoenix Homeopathic Hospital opens in Kadawatha
original_body_lines: The Phoenix Homeopathic Private Hospital was recently inaugurated under the patronage of Stete Minister of Indigenous Medicine Sisira Jayakody. Homeopathic practitioner, Dr. P.M. Chatura Hatharasinghe commenced this hospital, which provides treatment under the world-recognized homeopathic medical field. Having completed a degree in homeopathic medicine from the National Institute of Homeopathy in Calcutta, India, with a scholarship received from the Ministry of Indigenous Medicine, Dr. Hatharasinghe has been working in the country as a government-registered homeopathic practitioner for more than four years.

Dr. Hatharasinghe speaking during the event said: “Nowadays, many patients around the world have turned to homeopathic medicine and have been cured. Especially in Sri Lanka, many people have great faith in homeopathic medicine. Phoenix Hospital can promote homeopathic medicine in Sri Lanka as well as providing quick recovery to patients. I am especially thankful to the State Minister of Indigenous Medicine Sisira Jayakody, for his support in making this task a success.”
